champsmortality 0.0.1
  • Reference

    Reference

    All functions

    batch_rates_and_fractions()

    Calculate rates and fraction of an input list of values.

    combine_decision_tables()

    Combine mits_factor_tables() and cond_factor_tables() output to one decision dataframe

    cond_factor_tables()

    Compute counts of MITS cases and non-cases for a given condition by factors

    create_dataset_directory()

    Create a dataset directory with the shell of a config.yaml file

    get_interval()

    Get a credible interval for a fraction

    get_rate_frac_data()

    Get data necessary to compute adjusted mortality fractions and rates

    get_rates_and_fractions()

    Get rate and fraction data

    get_site_info()

    Get a list of sites and catchments with data start and end years

    has_champs_group()

    Check to see if a CHAMPS group is in the causal chain

    has_icd10()

    Check to see if an ICD10 regular expression is in the causal chain

    has_maternal_champs_group()

    Check to see if a CHAMPS group is in the main maternal cause

    has_maternal_icd10()

    Check to see if an ICD10 regular expression is in the main maternal cause

    make_outputs()

    Create html outputs for a given mortality rate/fraction analysis

    mits_factor_tables()

    Compute counts of MITS and non-MITS+DSS-only deaths by factors

    plot_rates_fracs()

    Create a plot of rates or fractions

    process_data()

    Process a set of CHAMPS data files

    rates_and_fractions_wide()

    Wrapper for get_rates_and_fractions()

    read_and_validate_data()

    Read and validate data files from a specified directory

    table_adjust_decision()

    Selected variables decision table

    table_factor_sig_stats()

    Build pretty table of factor significance and level counts

    table_overview()

    Create an overview table of results

    valid_conditions()

    Get a list of valid conditions found in the causal chain

    valid_maternal_conditions()

    Get a list of valid maternal conditions

    Contents

    Developed by Ryan Hafen, J Hathaway.
